  • Enum Constant Details

    • APPLICATION_NETWORK

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId APPLICATION_NETWORK
      Specifies the value to use for the application network for the domain. By default, the domain uses the IP address of the first interface. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • CHECKPOINT_REPOSITORY

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CHECKPOINT_REPOSITORY
      Specifies the default repository that is used to store application checkpoint information for instances without a specific repository set. DomainMXBean.CheckpointRepository defines valid values. The default is NOT_SPECIFIED. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • CHECKPOINT_REPOSITORY_CONFIGURATION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CHECKPOINT_REPOSITORY_CONFIGURATION
      Specifies the default configuration information for the repository that is used to store application checkpoint information for instances without specific repository configuration information set. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

      If the value of the CHECKPOINT_REPOSITORY property is NOT_SPECIFIED, the value of this property is ignored.

      If the value of the CHECKPOINT_REPOSITORY property is FILE_SYSTEM, this property specifies the absolute path to the root checkpointing directory. This directory must exist prior to performing checkpointing operations. If the instance is used to run jobs with restartable or relocatable operators, the checkpointing directory must be in a shared file system. The format of the value is a serialized string of a JSON object with a single string property named Dir. For example, {"Dir":"/home/user/ckpt"}

      If the value of the CHECKPOINT_REPOSITORY property is REDIS, this property specifies a list of host names and port numbers of the Redis servers. These servers must be accessible to resources running Streams jobs. Checkpoint data is automatically distributed among these servers. The format of the value is a serialized string of a JSON object with a numeric replicas property, a numeric shards property, and an array replicaGroups property. Each entry in the replicaGroups array is a serialized string of a JSON object with a string description property and a string array servers property. The format of each servers array entry is host:port. For example, with Redis servers organized as 2 shards with 3 replica groups, the property value would be:

      {"replicas":3,"shards":2,"replicaGroups":[{"servers":["host0:10000","host1:10001"],"description":"rack1" },{"servers":["host2:10002","host3:10003"],"description":"rack2"},{"servers":["host4:10004","host5:10005"],"description":"rack3"}]}

      The replicas property specifies the number of replica groups, and must be an odd number (e.g., 1, 3, 5). Providing 2N+1 replicas can tolerate N replica failures. replicaGroups specifies a JSON array whose size must match the value of replicas. The shards property specifies the number of shards to distribute checkpoint data into, and it must be a positive integer number and match the number of servers specified in the servers array for each replicaGroup.

    • REPOSITORY_CONFIGURATION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId REPOSITORY_CONFIGURATION
      Specifies the default configuration information for the repository used to cache application bundles. Application bundles are cached to provide application high availability. This default is used for instances without specific repository configuration information set. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

      The format of the value is a serialized string of a JSON object with a required string property: type. Supported values are the strings: filesystem and ibmcloudobjectstorage.

      If the repository type is filesystem, baseDirectory is also a required string property. Its value is the absolute path to the root file system directory used to store repository items. This directory must exist in a shared file system, or on all nodes in the domain, prior to setting the REPOSITORY_CONFIGURATION property. Sub-directories are created under this root path as needed. The user Streams domain services run as must have read and write access to this directory. The user Streams instance services run as must also have read and write access to this directory.

      If the repository type is ibmcloudobjectstorage, endpoint, bucket and auth are additional required string properties. endpoint and bucket identify the IBM Cloud Object Storage endpoint and bucket used to store repository items. auth specifies the name of the restricted configuration item containing credentials to authenticate to the IBM Cloud Object Storage endpoint. The format of the restricted configuration item value is a serialized string of a JSON object with two required string properties: IBMCOSaccessKey and IBMCOSsecretKey. They identify the IBM Cloud Object Storage access key and secret key respectively. This restricted configuration item must exist before setting the REPOSITORY_CONFIGURATION property. See setRestrictedConfiguration for more information about restricted configuration items.

      If this value is not set, the default behavior is to use a file system repository with the base repository directory set to a path under the directory identified by the value of the APPLICATION_BUNDLES_PATH property.

      See Also:
      • InstanceMXBean.PropertyId.REPOSITORY_CONFIGURATION_APPLICATION_CACHE

    • APPLICATION_BUNDLES_PATH

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId APPLICATION_BUNDLES_PATH
      Specifies the default directory path to the location where the Streams application bundles are stored. This property value is the root level directory that contains the Streams application bundle files. More subdirectories are created as needed. The default is home directory of user/.streams/var. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • APPLICATION_CURRENT_WORKING_PATH

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId APPLICATION_CURRENT_WORKING_PATH
      Specifies the default current working directory to be used by streams processing applications. In particular, the directory is used for file operations that do not reference the data path for the job. This directory is the root level directory that contains the Streams application data files. More subdirectories are created as needed. The default is home directory of user/.streams/var. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • PRELOAD_APPLICATION_BUNDLES

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId PRELOAD_APPLICATION_BUNDLES
      Specifies whether the application bundle file that is associated with a submitted job is preloaded on every resource in the instance where the job is submitted. If the property value is false, the application bundle file is only loaded on the resources that are currently needed to run one or more of the processing elements for the job. The default is false.

    • CONFIGURATION_VERSION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONFIGURATION_VERSION
      Specifies the version of the domain configuration data.

    • CREATION_USER

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CREATION_USER
      Specifies the user who created the domain.

    • CREATION_TIME

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CREATION_TIME
      Specifies the time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the domain was created.

    • LOCALE_OVERRIDE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId LOCALE_OVERRIDE
      Specifies the locale that is used by Streams services for tasks such as logging. This property value uses the following locale format: language[_territory][.codeset] The default behavior for domain services is to use the locale of the environment used to start the domain. The default behavior for instance services is to use the locale of the environment used to start the instance. If this value is not available, en_US.UTF-8 is used.

    • PORT_RANGE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId PORT_RANGE
      Specifies the range of port numbers for the Streams services. This value must be specified as a string with the following format: minimumPortNumber-maximumPortNumber. Multiple ranges can be specified that are separated by commas. Single port values can also be specified that are separated by commas. The default is not to restrict the range of ports used for Streams services. When you update this property value, the change only affects subsequent port selections.

    • EXTERNAL_RESOURCE_MANAGER

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId EXTERNAL_RESOURCE_MANAGER
      Specifies the external resource manager used for allocating new resources. The default value is null which means no external resource manager is used. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts. When the change occurs, the resource tag definitions are also removed for all resource tags. Currently, only the streams resource manager is supported.

    • MANAGEMENT_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_TAGS

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId MANAGEMENT_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_TAGS
      Identifies the set of tags to include on an allocation request for a resource used to run domain services. These tags are used to control which services run on the same resource and which run on a separate resource. This property is only used if an external resource manager is used for the allocation. If the Streams resource manager is used, this property is ignored and any tags added to the hosts are used to determine service placement. If this value does not include the authentication tag, the authentication tag is added. The following tags are also valid: audit, jmx, sws. The services for all specified tags are started on the same resource. The services for all omitted tags are each started on a separate resource. User-defined tags can also be included in this property value. The format of the value is a comma separated list of tag names. The default value is: authentication,audit,jmx,sws. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.
      See Also:
      • EXTERNAL_RESOURCE_MANAGER

    • FUSION_SCHEME

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId FUSION_SCHEME
      Specifies the default scheme used to determine how to fuse an application's operators into PEs. DomainMXBean.FusionScheme defines valid values. The InstanceMXBean.PropertyId FUSION_SCHEME property can be set to override this value for an instance. The default value is AUTOMATIC.

    • PLACEMENT_SCHEME

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId PLACEMENT_SCHEME
      Specifies the default scheme used to determine how to place PEs on resources. DomainMXBean.PlacementScheme defines valid values. The InstanceMXBean.PropertyId PLACEMENT_SCHEME property can be set to override this value for an instance. The default value is BALANCED_INSTANCE .

    • THREADING_MODEL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId THREADING_MODEL
      Specifies the default model which determines how threads run operators in a PE. DomainMXBean.ThreadingModel defines valid values. The InstanceMXBean.PropertyId THREADING_MODEL property can be set to override this value for an instance. The default value is NOT_SPECIFIED which means the default behavior is determined by the SPL run-time.

    • DYNAMIC_THREADING_ELASTIC

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId DYNAMIC_THREADING_ELASTIC
      Specifies the default indicator for whether a PE should dynamically adapt the number of threads used for dynamic threading in the PE, based on performance. This value is only used when the value of THREADING_MODEL is DomainMXBean.ThreadingModel.DYNAMIC. The InstanceMXBean.PropertyId DYNAMIC_THREADING_ELASTIC property can be set to override this value for an instance. If this value is not set, the default behavior is determined by the SPL run-time.

    • DYNAMIC_THREADING_THREAD_COUNT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId DYNAMIC_THREADING_THREAD_COUNT
      Specifies the default initial number of threads used for dynamic threading in a PE. The value must be greater than or equal to 1. This value is only used when the value of THREADING_MODEL is DomainMXBean.ThreadingModel.DYNAMIC and the value of DYNAMIC_THREADING_ELASTIC is true. If the THREADING_MODEL is DYNAMIC and DYNAMIC_THREADING_ELASTIC is false, the initial number of threads for dynamic threading in a PE is determined at PE start time based on the available logical CPUs and on the system load. The InstanceMXBean.PropertyId DYNAMIC_THREADING_THREAD_COUNT property can be set to override this value for an instance. If this value is not set, the default behavior is determined by the SPL run-time.

    • DETERMINE_INSTANCE_START_AS_VERSION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId DETERMINE_INSTANCE_START_AS_VERSION
      Indicates whether the instance START_AS_VERSION property is automatically set when an instance is {@link com.ibm.streams.management.domain.DomainMXBean.makeInstance(String, String) created} or {@link com.ibm.streams.management.instance.InstanceMXBean.upgrade(String) upgraded}. If the value is true, the START_AS_VERSION is set to the version of the operation used to create or upgrade the instance. If the value is false, the instance START_AS_VERSION property is not changed when an instance is created or upgraded. The default value of this property is false.

    • TRANSPORT_SECURITY_TYPE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId TRANSPORT_SECURITY_TYPE
      Specifies the default cryptographic protocol to use when transporting data between processing elements (PEs). TransportSecurityType defines possible values. The default value is none When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • GOVERNANCE_ENABLED

      @Deprecated public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId GOVERNANCE_ENABLED
      Deprecated.
      Specifies the default indicator for whether governance is enabled for instances within the domain. The InfoSphere Information Governance Catalog is an interactive, web-based tool that you can use to create, manage, and share an enterprise vocabulary and classification system in a central catalog. When you configure Streams instances for data governance, they generate data flows and data lineage for the streams processing applications. The InstanceMXBean.PropertyId GOVERNANCE_ENABLED property can be set to override this value for an instance. The default value of this property is false.

    • GOVERNANCE_URL

      @Deprecated public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId GOVERNANCE_URL
      Deprecated.
      Specifies the default URL where governance information is sent. The InstanceMXBean.PropertyId GOVERNANCE_URL property can be set to override this value for an instance. There is no governance URL set for this property value by default.
      See Also:
      • GOVERNANCE_ENABLED

    • SSH_ALLOWED

      @Deprecated public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SSH_ALLOWED
      Deprecated.
      Specifies whether the secure shell (SSH) command can be used by Streams to perform remote tasks on domain resources. If this value is false, Streams cannot automatically restart the domain controller service on remote resources if necessary. If the resource is registered as a domain host using the streamtool registerdomainhost command, restarts are handled locally and SSH is not needed. If the resource is not registered as a domain host, the streamtool startdomainhost --unregistered command would need to be run on the resource manually when a restart of the domain controller service is needed. The default behavior is to allow SSH usage.

    • JVM_SIZE_COMPUTATION_ENABLED

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId JVM_SIZE_COMPUTATION_ENABLED
      Specifies whether Streams should calculate the maximum amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment when starting Streams services if a maximum value is not configured. If this value is false, the maximum amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment is determined by the Java environment at startup. The default behavior is to have Streams calculate the maximum memory to allocate when a maximum value is not configured. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • APPLICATION_ON_MANAGEMENT_RESOURCE_ALLOWED

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId APPLICATION_ON_MANAGEMENT_RESOURCE_ALLOWED
      Specifies whether Streams should allow applications to run on management resources when not explicitly tagged as an application resource. The default behavior is that Streams will allow applications to run on management resources if there is no alternative.

    • DYNAMIC_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_ENABLED

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId DYNAMIC_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_ENABLED
      Specifies whether Streams should dynamically allocate resource to instances. The default behavior is that Streams will not dynamically allocate resources to instances. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • APPLICATION_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_MODE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId APPLICATION_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_MODE
      Specifies the default behavior for how application resources are allocated to jobs within an instance. DomainMXBean.ApplicationResourceAllocationMode defines valid values. The default is INSTANCE.

    • JOB_RESOURCE_SHARING

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId JOB_RESOURCE_SHARING
      Specifies the default behavior for if and how jobs can run on resources where other jobs are running. DomainMXBean.JobResourceSharing defines valid values. The default is SAME_JOB. Job resource sharing only applies if the instance is configured with APPLICATION_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_MODE set to JOB. In this case, a separate set of resources is allocated for each job by default. The JOB_RESOURCE_SHARING property specifies how to handle resource allocation requests for a job when insufficient resources exist to achieve this level of isolation.

    • PROPOSED_OPERATORS_PER_RESOURCE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId PROPOSED_OPERATORS_PER_RESOURCE
      Specifies the default proposed number of operators to be placed on each resource for a job. Valid values are positive integers greater than zero. The default is 8. This property only applies if APPLICATION_RESOURCE_ALLOCATION_MODE is JOB. In this case, the PROPOSED_OPERATORS_PER_RESOURCE property is used with other information to determine the number of resources to request for a job.

    • RESOURCE_CPU_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId RESOURCE_CPU_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD
      Specifies the default CPU usage percentage below which a resource is considered under utilized. Valid values are positive integers greater than zero but less than or equal to the value of RESOURCE_CPU_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD. The default is 100.

    • RESOURCE_CPU_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId RESOURCE_CPU_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD
      Specifies the default CPU usage percentage above which a resource is considered overloaded. Valid values are positive integers less than or equal to 100 but greater than or equal to the value of RESOURCE_CPU_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD. The default is 100.

    • RESOURCE_MEMORY_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId RESOURCE_MEMORY_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD
      Specifies the default memory usage percentage below which a resource is considered under utilized. Valid values are positive integers greater than zero but less than or equal to the value of RESOURCE_MEMORY_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD. The default is 100.

    • RESOURCE_MEMORY_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId RESOURCE_MEMORY_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD
      Specifies the default memory usage percentage above which a resource is considered overloaded. Valid values are positive integers less than or equal to 100 but greater than or equal to the value of RESOURCE_MEMORY_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD. The default is 100.

    • RESOURCE_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId RESOURCE_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD
      Specifies the default network bandwidth usage percentage below which a resource is considered under utilized. Valid values are positive integers greater than zero but less than or equal to the value of RESOURCE_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD. The default is 100.

    • RESOURCE_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId RESOURCE_NETWORK_BANDWIDTH_USAGE_UPPER_THRESHOLD
      Specifies the default network bandwidth usage percentage above which a resource is considered overloaded. Valid values are positive integers less than or equal to 100 but greater than or equal to the value of RESOURCE_MEMORY_USAGE_LOWER_THRESHOLD. The default is 100.

    • SERVICE_METRIC_COLLECTION_ENABLED

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SERVICE_METRIC_COLLECTION_ENABLED
      Specifies whether metric information is collected for Streams services. The default value of this property is false.

    • SSL_OPTION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SSL_OPTION
      Specifies the default cryptographic protocols to support for service connections. DomainServiceMXBean.SSLOption defines possible values. The default is TLSv1 When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AAS_SSL_OPTION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_SSL_OPTION
      Specifies the cryptographic protocols to support for authentication and authorization service connections. DomainServiceMXBean.SSLOption defines possible values. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by DomainMXBean.PropertyId SSL_OPTION See the domain property description for more details. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AUDITLOG_SSL_OPTION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_SSL_OPTION
      Specifies the cryptographic protocols to support for logging service connections. DomainServiceMXBean.SSLOption defines possible values. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by DomainMXBean.PropertyId SSL_OPTION See the domain property description for more details. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • JMX_SSL_OPTION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId JMX_SSL_OPTION
      Specifies the cryptographic protocols to support for management API service connections. DomainServiceMXBean.SSLOption defines possible values. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by DomainMXBean.PropertyId SSL_OPTION See the domain property description for more details. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • CONTROLLER_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE
      Specifies the initial amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment for the domain controller service. The size is specified in megabytes (MB). The value must be between 512 and the value of CONTROLLER_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE. The default behavior is to use the initial size determined by the Java environment at startup. If a value is set for this property, a value must also be set for CONTROLLER_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE. Otherwise, the service fails to start. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • CONTROLLER_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE
      Specifies the maximum amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment for the domain controller service. The size is specified in megabytes (MB). The value must be greater than or equal to the value of CONTROLLER_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE. The default behavior is to use the maximum size determined by Streams at startup. If the value of JVM_SIZE_COMPUTATION_ENABLED is false, the default behavior is to use the maximum size determined by the Java environment at startup. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • CONTROLLER_SSL_OPTION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_SSL_OPTION
      Specifies the cryptographic protocols to support for domain controller service connections. DomainServiceMXBean.SSLOption defines possible values. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by DomainMXBean.PropertyId SSL_OPTION See the domain property description for more details. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SERVICE_RETRY_COUNT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SERVICE_RETRY_COUNT
      Specifies the number of times to attempt to restart a service. If a software, hardware, or network interruption occurs and a domain service fails, Streams tries to restart the service. The default is 3 tries.

    • SERVICE_START_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SERVICE_START_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for starting a Streams service. Streams pings the specified number of times at one second intervals, waiting for the service to respond. If the service does not respond within the specified timeout period, the service fails to start. The property value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default value is 30 seconds.

    • SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout, in seconds, for stopping Streams services. The property value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default is 30 seconds.

    • SERVICE_HEALTH_INTERVAL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SERVICE_HEALTH_INTERVAL
      Specifies the frequency (in seconds) at which service health information is retrieved. The value must be between 5 and the value of SERVICE_HEALTH_TIMEOUT The default is 15 seconds.

    • SERVICE_HEALTH_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SERVICE_HEALTH_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the amount of time to wait (in seconds) for service health information before determining the service is inactive. The value must be greater than or equal to the value of SERVICE_HEALTH_INTERVAL. The default is 30 seconds.

    • HIGH_AVAILABILITY_COUNT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId HIGH_AVAILABILITY_COUNT
      Specifies the total number of each Streams domain management service. The value must be between 1 and 5, inclusive. To configure high availability in Streams enterprise domains, specify a value greater than 1. The default value is 1. More information about Streams high availability support can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Configuring high availability in Teracloud Streams enterprise domains.

    • FILE_STORAGE_PATH

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId FILE_STORAGE_PATH
      Specifies the directory path where the Streams class cache files and other temporary files should be stored. This path is the root level directory that contains these files. The directory must exist before starting the Streams domain. More subdirectories are created as needed. The default is /tmp. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AAS_TRACE_LEVEL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_TRACE_LEVEL
      Specifies the trace level override for the authentication and authorization service. If set, this property overrides TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL for the authentication and authorization service. DomainTracingPropertiesMXBean.Level defines valid values. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL

    • AAS_START_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_START_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout specification override (in seconds) for authentication and authorization service startup. If set, this property overrides SERVICE_START_TIMEOUT for the authentication and authorization service. The value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by SERVICE_START_TIMEOUT

    • AAS_STOP_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_STOP_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout specification override (in seconds) for authentication and authorization service shutdown. If set, this property overrides SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT for the authentication and authorization service. The value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT

    • AAS_PORT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_PORT
      Specifies the SSL port number for the authentication and authorization service. If a value of zero is specified, an open port is dynamically chosen when the service starts. If a value is set for PORT_RANGE the port is chosen from the specified port range; otherwise, it is chosen from the system port range. The default is 0. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AAS_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE
      Specifies the initial amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment for the authentication and authorization service. The size is specified in megabytes (MB). This property only applies if SECURITY_RUN_AS_ROOT is true, which causes the authentication service to run in its own Java environment. The value must be between 512 and the value of AAS_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE. The default behavior is to use the initial size determined by the Java environment at startup. If a value is set for this property, a value must also be set for AAS_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE. Otherwise, the service fails to start. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AAS_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE
      Specifies the maximum amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment for the authentication and authorization service. The size is specified in megabytes (MB). This property only applies if SECURITY_RUN_AS_ROOT is true, which causes the authentication service to run in its own Java environment. The value must be greater than or equal to the value of AAS_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE. The default behavior is to use the maximum size determined by Streams at startup. If the value of JVM_SIZE_COMPUTATION_ENABLED is false, the default behavior is to use the maximum size determined by the Java environment at startup. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SWS_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SWS_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE
      Specifies the maximum amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment for the web management service. The size is specified in megabytes (MB). The value must be greater than or equal to the value of SWS_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE. The default behavior is to use the maximum size determined by Streams at startup. If the value of JVM_SIZE_COMPUTATION_ENABLED is false, the default behavior is to use the maximum size determined by the Java environment at startup. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SWS_ENABLE_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SWS_ENABLE_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION
      Specifies whether client authentication should be enabled for the web management service. The default is false. If set to true, the client certificates for trusted clients must be added to the truststore by using the streamtool addcertificate command. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SWS_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION_CERTIFICATE_REQUIRED

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SWS_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION_CERTIFICATE_REQUIRED
      Specifies whether a certificate is required when client authentication is enabled for web management services. If this property value is true, a client certificate must be added to the truststore by using the streamtool addcertificate command and the client must present this certificate when connecting to the service. If this property value is false and a client does not have a certificate in the truststore or does not present a certificate on the connection, the client can supply credentials to authenticate. This property value is ignored if SWS_ENABLE_CLIENT_AUTHENTICATION is false.

    • SWS_TRACE_LEVEL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SWS_TRACE_LEVEL
      Specifies the trace level override for the web management service. If set, this property overrides TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL for the web management service. DomainTracingPropertiesMXBean.Level defines valid values. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL

    • SWS_START_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SWS_START_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout specification override (in seconds) for SWS service startup. The value must be greater than or equal to 1 minute. The default is 2 minutes.

    • SWS_STOP_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SWS_STOP_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout specification override (in seconds) for web management service shutdown. If set, this property overrides SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT for the web management service. The value must be greater than or equal to 1 minute. The default is 2 minutes.

    • SWS_SSL_PROTOCOL

    • LOG_LEVEL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId LOG_LEVEL
      Specifies the logging level to use for the product administration log. LoggingPropertiesMXBean.Level defines valid values. The default is WARNING

    • LOG_TYPE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId LOG_TYPE
      Specifies the type of log to use for product administration logging. The log messages can be sent to a rolling log file or to the Linux syslog logging interface. LoggingPropertiesMXBean.Type defines valid values. The default is FILE When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • LOG_MAXIMUM_FILE_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId LOG_MAXIMUM_FILE_SIZE
      Specifies the maximum size in kilobytes of the product administration log files. This property applies when the log Type is FILE. The value must be greater than or equal to 1024. The default is 5000 kilobytes. A change to this value only takes effect if the logging service restarts.

    • LOG_MAXIMUM_FILE_COUNT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId LOG_MAXIMUM_FILE_COUNT
      Specifies the maximum number of product administration log files to save. This property applies when the log Type is FILE. The default is 3 log files. A change to this value only takes effect if the logging service restarts.

    • TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL
      Specifies the default trace level to use for debugging problems with Streams domain services. DomainTracingPropertiesMXBean.Level defines valid values. The default value is ERROR.

    • TRACE_MAXIMUM_FILE_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId TRACE_MAXIMUM_FILE_SIZE
      Specifies the maximum size in kilobytes of trace files. The value must be greater than or equal to 1024. The default is 5000 kilobytes. When you update this property value, the change does not occur for a service until the service restarts.

    • TRACE_MAXIMUM_FILE_COUNT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId TRACE_MAXIMUM_FILE_COUNT
      Specifies the maximum number of trace files to save per service. The default is 3 trace files. When you update this property value, the change does not occur for a service until the service restarts.

    • SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION_TYPE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION_TYPE
      Specifies the authentication scheme used to validate users. SecurityPropertiesMXBean.AuthenticationType defines valid values. The default is PAM.

    • SECURITY_SESSION_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_SESSION_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the inactivity time in seconds to wait before timing out a security session. The value must be greater than or equal to one minute. The default is 4 hours. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_PAM_SERVICE_NAME

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_PAM_SERVICE_NAME
      Specifies the name of the PAM service to use for authentication. The PAM authentication service name corresponds to a file in /etc/pam.d. If the administrator wants to separate the users that are allowed to authenticate to the cluster from the users that are allowed to use Streams, the administrator could choose a different service or define a new service and configure the new service for Streams. The default value is login

    • SECURITY_PAM_KEYS_ENABLED

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_PAM_KEYS_ENABLED
      Specifies whether authentication keys are enabled when using the PAM login service. If authentication keys are enabled, the streamtool genkey command can be used to generate public and private keys for the domain. This eliminates the need for users to enter a password when running Streams commands.

    • SECURITY_LDAP_SERVER_URL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LDAP_SERVER_URL
      Specifies the URL to the LDAP server used for authentication.

    • SECURITY_LDAP_USER_DISTINGUISHED_NAME_PATTERN

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LDAP_USER_DISTINGUISHED_NAME_PATTERN
      Specifies the pattern used to create a distinguished name (DN) for a user during login when LDAP is used for authentication. For example, cn=*,ou=People,ou=streams,o=ibm.com. In this example, the user name will be substituted for * in the pattern when the user logs in.

    • SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_OBJECT_CLASS

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_OBJECT_CLASS
      Specifies the group object class used to search for group names in LDAP. Common object classes include groupOfNames, groupOfUniqueNames, and posixGroup.

    • SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_SEARCH_BASE_DISTINGUISHED_NAME

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_SEARCH_BASE_DISTINGUISHED_NAME
      Specifies the base distinguished name (DN) used to search for groups in LDAP. For example, ou=Groups,ou=streams,o=ibm.com.

    • SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_MEMBERS_ATTRIBUTE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_MEMBERS_ATTRIBUTE
      Specifies the name of the element in the group record containing the list of members in the group. If the SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_OBJECT_CLASS is groupOfNames, a default of member is used. If the SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_OBJECT_CLASS is groupOfUniqueNames, a default of uniqueMember is used. If the SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_OBJECT_CLASS is posixGroup, a default of memberUid is used.

    • SECURITY_LDAP_USER_ATTRIBUTE_IN_GROUP

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LDAP_USER_ATTRIBUTE_IN_GROUP
      Specifies the name of the user record element stored in the group record. If the SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_OBJECT_CLASS is groupOfNames or groupOfUniqueNames, a default of dn is used. If the SECURITY_LDAP_GROUP_OBJECT_CLASS is posixGroup, a default of uid is used.

    • SECURITY_LDAP_USER_SECONDARY_LOOKUP

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LDAP_USER_SECONDARY_LOOKUP
      Specifies the LDAP query used to resolve the LDAP user name based on the provided Streams user name. The resolved LDAP user name is then used on authentication queries with the LDAP server. For example, "(&(objectclass=ibmperson)(notesshortname=*)) uid" . In this example the Streams user name replaces the * in the query string and the uid element in the result record contains the LDAP user name.

    • SECURITY_CERTIFICATE_USER_REGULAR_EXPRESSION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_CERTIFICATE_USER_REGULAR_EXPRESSION
      Specifies the format of the certificate used to determine how to extract the Steams user identifier from the certificate distinguished name (DN). The default value is ${cn} which indicates the common name should be used.

    • SECURITY_REVOCATION_FILE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_REVOCATION_FILE
      Specifies the location of a file containing a list of certificates that are not yet expired but have been revoked. If certificate authentication is not being used, this property is ignored. If certificate authentication is being used and a value is specified for this property, the list is checked as part of certificate validation; otherwise, a file is not used to retrieve a revocation list. This file must exist on all resources where the Streams authentication service runs and the Streams the user who started the domain must have read access to this file. The default is null which means a file is not used to retrieve a revocation list.

    • SECURITY_REVOCATION_LDAP_URL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_REVOCATION_LDAP_URL
      Specifies an LDAP URL that can be used to retrieve a list of certificates that are not yet expired but have been revoked. If certificate authentication is not being used, this property is ignored. If certificate authentication is being used and a value is specified for this property, the list is checked as part of certificate validation; otherwise, an LDAP URL is not used to retrieve a revocation list. The default is null which means an LDAP URL is not used to retrieve a revocation list.

    • SECURITY_REVOCATION_METHOD

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_REVOCATION_METHOD
      Specifies the method used for checking whether a certificate has been revoked. If certificate authentication is not being used, this property is ignored. SecurityPropertiesMXBean.RevocationMethod defines possible values. The default value is AUTOMATIC. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_RUN_AS_ROOT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_RUN_AS_ROOT
      Specifies whether the authentication service should be run using the root account. Running the authentication service using the root account allows users other than the domain owner to be authenticated with the security mechanism of PAM with the UNIX back-end. This property only pertains to secondary installs registered as a system service. The default is false.

    • SECURITY_LOGIN_MODULE_CONFIGURATION

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LOGIN_MODULE_CONFIGURATION
      Specifies the JAAS security authentication configuration information. This configuration contains an item for each JAAS login module. This property value is only used when JAAS authentication is configured. More information about using JAAS authentication with Streams can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Setting up login module authentication for Teracloud Streams users. By default, there is no configuration information set.

    • SECURITY_LOGIN_MODULE_PATH

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_LOGIN_MODULE_PATH
      Specifies the file system path where the user-defined login module is stored. This property value is only used when JAAS authentication is configured. More information about using JAAS authentication with Streams can be found in the product documentation. See topic: Setting up login module authentication for Teracloud Streams users. The default is home directory of user/.streams/var/security/modules . When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_WORKING_PATH

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_WORKING_PATH
      Specifies the file system path used to store temporary files for security processing. The default is home directory of user/.streams/var/security/workarea . When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_KERBEROS_ENABLED

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_KERBEROS_ENABLED
      Specifies whether Kerberos authentication is enabled. If this value is true and Kerberos authentication fails, the authentication scheme specified by SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION_TYPE is used. The default value is false. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_KERBEROS_CONFIGURATION_FILE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_KERBEROS_CONFIGURATION_FILE
      Specifies the location of the Kerberos configuration file. This file contains the default realm, the default Key Distribution Center (KDC), and other settings needed for Kerberos authentication. If this value is not set, the default behavior is to first check for java.home/lib/security/krb5.conf, and if not found, check for /etc/krb5/conf on the resource where the authentication and authorization service is running. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_KERBEROS_KDC

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_KERBEROS_KDC
      Specifies the host name of the default Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC). The value of this property overrides the default KDC specified in the SECURITY_KERBEROS_CONFIGURATION_FILE. If this value is set, but a value is not set for SECURITY_KERBEROS_REALM Kerberos authentication fails and authentication is done using the authentication scheme specified by SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION_TYPE. If this value is not set, the default behavior is to retrieve the value from the Kerberos configuration file. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_KERBEROS_REALM

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_KERBEROS_REALM
      Specifies the name of the default Kerberos realm. The value of this property overrides the default realm specified in the SECURITY_KERBEROS_CONFIGURATION_FILE. If this value is set, but a value is not set for SECURITY_KERBEROS_KDC Kerberos authentication fails and authentication is done using the authentication scheme specified by the value of SECURITY_AUTHENTICATION_TYPE. If this value is not set, the default behavior is to retrieve the value from the Kerberos configuration file. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_KERBEROS_PRINCIPAL_MAPPING

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_KERBEROS_PRINCIPAL_MAPPING
      Specifies the default Kerberos principal mapping. This mapping provides a set of rules to translate from a Kerberos user principal to a Streams user name. The format of the value is a list of rules separated by whitespace characters. DEFAULT can be included in the list to specify the principal name in the default domain maps to the Streams user name. For example, streamsuser@IBM.COM maps to streamsuser.

      The format of a rule is RULE:exp and the format of exp is [n:string](regexp)s/pattern/replacement/g. The integer n indicates how many components the target principal should have. If this matches then a string will be formed from string, substituting the realm of the principal for $0 and the n‘th component of the principal for $n If this string matches regexp, then the s//[g] substitution command will be run over the string. The optional g will cause the substitution to be global over the string, instead of replacing only the first match in the string.

      An example principal mapping is: RULE:[1:$1@$0](.*@IBM.COM)s/@.*\// DEFAULT

      Rules are processed in order. The first rule matching a principal name is used to perform the mapping and all subsequent rules are ignored. If this value is not set, the default behavior is to map the principal name in the default domain to the Streams user name. The default value is DEFAULT. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_KERBEROS_REMOVE_HOST_FROM_PRINCIPAL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_KERBEROS_REMOVE_HOST_FROM_PRINCIPAL
      Indicates whether the host portion of the Kerberos principal is to be removed. For example, if the Kerberos principal is user/server1.ibm.com@IBM.COM and this property value is true, the principal is converted to user@IBM.COM The default value is true. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_KERBEROS_REMOVE_REALM_FROM_PRINCIPAL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_KERBEROS_REMOVE_REALM_FROM_PRINCIPAL
      Indicates whether the realm portion of the Kerberos principal is to be removed. For example, if the Kerberos principal is user/server1.ibm.com@IBM.COM and this property value is true, the principal is converted to user/server1.ibm.com The default value is true. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_KERBEROS_DEBUG

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_KERBEROS_DEBUG
      Indicates whether Kerberos debugging is turned on to gather diagnostics. The default value is false. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AAS_KERBEROS_SERVICE_PRINCIPAL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_KERBEROS_SERVICE_PRINCIPAL
      Specifies the authentication and authorization service (AAS) principal name registered with the Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC). The default value is streams-aas/%STREAMS_RESOURCE%, where %STREAMS_RESOURCE% is replaced with the resource identifier for the resource where AAS is running. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.
      See Also:
      • ResourceMXBean.getId()

    • AAS_KERBEROS_KEYTAB_FILE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AAS_KERBEROS_KEYTAB_FILE
      Specifies the location of the Kerberos keytab file. This file contains an encrypted copy of the host's key and is used to authenticate to the Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC). The default value is %STREAMS_USER_HOME%/.streams/var/security/keytabs/streams-aas.keytab, where %STREAMS_USER_HOME% is replaced with home directory of the user who started the domain. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SWS_KERBEROS_SERVICE_PRINCIPAL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SWS_KERBEROS_SERVICE_PRINCIPAL
      Specifies the web management service (SWS) principal name registered with the Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC). The default value is HTTP/%STREAMS_RESOURCE%, where %STREAMS_RESOURCE% is replaced with the resource identifier for the resource where SWS is running. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.
      See Also:
      • ResourceMXBean.getId()

    • SWS_KERBEROS_KEYTAB_FILE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SWS_KERBEROS_KEYTAB_FILE
      Specifies the location of the Kerberos keytab file. This file contains an encrypted copy of the host's key and is used to authenticate to the Kerberos Key Distribution Center (KDC). The default value is %STREAMS_USER_HOME%/.streams/var/security/keytabs/streams-sws.keytab, where %STREAMS_USER_HOME% is replaced with home directory of the user who started the domain. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_IAM_ENABLED

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_IAM_ENABLED
      Specifies whether IBM Identity and Access Management (IAM) authentication is enabled. The default value is false. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • SECURITY_IAM_AUTHORIZATION_ENDPOINT_URL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_IAM_AUTHORIZATION_ENDPOINT_URL
      Specifies the URL of the endpoint used to authenticate and authorize users when IBM Identity and Access Management (IAM) authentication is used. The default value is https://iam.ng.bluemix.net/oidc/authorize

    • SECURITY_IAM_LOGOUT_ENDPOINT_URL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_IAM_LOGOUT_ENDPOINT_URL
      Specifies the URL of the endpoint used to handle IBM Identity and Access Management (IAM) logout requests. The default value is https://iam.ng.bluemix.net/oidc/logout

    • SECURITY_IAM_TOKEN_ENDPOINT_URL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_IAM_TOKEN_ENDPOINT_URL
      Specifies the URL of the endpoint used to obtain IBM Identity and Access Management (IAM) tokens. The default value is https://iam.ng.bluemix.net/oidc/token

    • SECURITY_IAM_JWKS_ENDPOINT_URL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId SECURITY_IAM_JWKS_ENDPOINT_URL
      Specifies the URL of the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) endpoint used to verify the digital signatures of IBM Identity and Access Management (IAM) tokens. The default value is https://iam.ng.bluemix.net/oidc/jwks

    • CONTROLLER_PORT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_PORT
      Specifies the SSL port number for the domain controller service. If a value of zero is specified, an open port is dynamically chosen when the service starts. If a value is set for PORT_RANGE the port is chosen from the specified port range; otherwise, it is chosen from the system port range. The default is 0. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • CONTROLLER_TRACE_LEVEL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_TRACE_LEVEL
      Specifies the trace level override for the domain controller service. If set, this property overrides TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL for the domain controller service. DomainTracingPropertiesMXBean.Level defines valid values. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL

    • CONTROLLER_START_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_START_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout specification override (in seconds) for domain controller service startup. If set, this property overrides SERVICE_START_TIMEOUT for the domain controller service. The value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by SERVICE_START_TIMEOUT

    • CONTROLLER_STOP_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_STOP_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout specification override (in seconds) for domain controller service shutdown. If set, this property overrides SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT for the domain controller service. The value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT

    • CONTROLLER_SYSTEM_STATISTICS_INTERVAL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_SYSTEM_STATISTICS_INTERVAL
      Specifies the frequency (in seconds) at which system statistics are retrieved. The value must be greater than or equal to 5. The default is 60 seconds.

    • CONTROLLER_RESOURCE_HEALTH_INTERVAL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_RESOURCE_HEALTH_INTERVAL
      Specifies the frequency (in seconds) at which resource health information is retrieved. The value must be between 10 and the value of CONTROLLER_RESOURCE_HEALTH_TIMEOUT. The default is 60 seconds.

    • CONTROLLER_RESOURCE_HEALTH_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_RESOURCE_HEALTH_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the amount of time to wait (in seconds) for resource health information before determining the service is inactive. The value must be greater than or equal to the value of CONTROLLER_RESOURCE_HEALTH_INTERVAL. The default is 2 minutes.

    • CONTROLLER_REQUEST_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId CONTROLLER_REQUEST_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the maximum amount of time (in seconds) to wait for requests to the Streams domain controller to complete. The value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default is 30 seconds.

    • AUDITLOG_LEVEL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_LEVEL
      Specifies the level of audit logging in effect. DomainServiceMXBean.AuditLogLevel defines possible values.

    • AUDITLOG_PORT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_PORT
      Specifies the SSL port number for the logging service. If a value of zero is specified, an open port is dynamically chosen when the service starts. If a value is set for PORT_RANGE the port is chosen from the specified port range; otherwise, it is chosen from the system port range. The default is 0. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AUDITLOG_TRACE_LEVEL

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_TRACE_LEVEL
      Specifies the trace level override for the logging service. If set, this property overrides TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL for the logging service. DomainTracingPropertiesMXBean.Level defines valid values. The default is OFF. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by TRACE_DEFAULT_LEVEL

    • AUDITLOG_START_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_START_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout specification override (in seconds) for logging service startup. If set, this property overrides SERVICE_START_TIMEOUT for the logging service. The value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by SERVICE_START_TIMEOUT

    • AUDITLOG_STOP_TIMEOUT

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_STOP_TIMEOUT
      Specifies the timeout specification override (in seconds) for logging service shutdown. If set, this property overrides SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT for the logging service. The value must be greater than or equal to 30. The default behavior is to use the value that is specified by SERVICE_STOP_TIMEOUT

    • AUDITLOG_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE
      Specifies the initial amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment for the logging service. The size is specified in megabytes (MB). This property only applies if SECURITY_RUN_AS_ROOT is true, which causes the logging service to run in its own Java environment. The value must be between 512 and the value of AUDITLOG_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE. The default behavior is to use the initial size determined by the Java environment at startup. If a value is set for this property, a value must also be set for AUDITLOG_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE. Otherwise, the service fails to start. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AUDITLOG_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_MAXIMUM_JVM_SIZE
      Specifies the maximum amount of memory to allocate to the Java environment for the logging service. The size is specified in megabytes (MB). This property only applies if SECURITY_RUN_AS_ROOT is true, which causes the logging service to run in its own Java environment. The value must be greater than or equal to the value of AUDITLOG_INITIAL_JVM_SIZE. The default behavior is to use the maximum size determined by Streams at startup. If the value of JVM_SIZE_COMPUTATION_ENABLED is false, the default behavior is to use the maximum size determined by the Java environment at startup. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AUDITLOG_LOG4J_PROPERTIES_FILE

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_LOG4J_PROPERTIES_FILE
      Specifies the location of the log4j properties file. This file must exist on all resources where the Streams logging service runs and the Streams domain owner must have read access to this file. Auditing is not enabled if no properties file is specified. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.

    • AUDITLOG_LOG4J_APPENDER_CLASSPATH

      public static final DomainMXBean.PropertyId AUDITLOG_LOG4J_APPENDER_CLASSPATH
      Specifies the content to append to the Java class path in order to locate any log4j appenders that are referenced in the log4j properties file. The log4j appenders must exist on all resources where the Streams auditing service runs and the Streams the user who started the domain must have read access to the appenders. When you update this property value, the change does not occur until the domain restarts.
